title: Is there a way to use Python from Excel, so that I can call Python functions directly from Excel cells? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yeah, you can use xlwings or pyxll.And you still can use the COM approach using the PyWin32 module. But i suggest a better approach where you'll use EXCEL spreadsheets  as a data input support (excel is a very good tool at manipulating and normalizing data).And use Python as your main scripting and data mining tool, that way you'll get a good separation of data and logic.Take a look for IPython, Pandas, numpy, openpyxl and the Anaconda python distribution.Hope it helps.

You can read in the Excel file as a csv, and then edit it via Python. There's also this article that came out earlier this year: Excel gets Python programming power, thanks to Xlwings library Otherwise this is how you read/write CSV: 13.1. csv - CSV File Reading and Writing - Python 2.7.9 documentation
